Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative rules
and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the continual
needs, protection, and supervision of residents
2

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There was an incident of a sexual inappropriateness between two youth
at the facility. Details are unknown.
Investigation Interviews
Complaint source was interviewed via phone on February 3, 2023.
Complaint source reported she was the clinician that completed the
trauma assessment for Youth A. She reported Youth A was very
guarded during the assessment and would not disclose any further
detail of the concern of a peer touching them inappropriately. Complaint
source noted no other concerns about the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 6,
2023. Youth A reported she was previously in a dating relationship with
Youth B. She reported she felt that Youth B persuaded her to do things
she did not want to do such as talk inappropriately, allow Youth B to
touch her lower back and kiss her. Youth A reported the kiss happened
a long time ago and no staff or youth were present. She reported she
did not want to go into detail. Youth A reported Youth B will sometimes
rub her hand up against her back and that makes Youth A feel
uncomfortable. She reported Youth B will sometimes flash her with
lifting her shirt and will make inappropriate comments and jokes. Youth
A reported staff do a good job supervising the unit and Youth B will do
this when staff are distracted and not looking. She reported no other
youth are around when Youth B does these inappropriate actions. She
reported Youth B can be sneaky. Youth A reported she never told staff
about this and only reported to Staff 3 she had concerns about Youth B
because Youth B is trying to date another girl on the unit. She reported
if staff are present and Youth B is not giving enough personal space or
saying something inappropriate, staff will intervene. Youth A reported
she never wanted to say anything to staff about Youth B being sexually
inappropriate because she did not want to make Youth B upset with
her.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 6,
2023. Youth B reported she feels safe at the facility and staff do a good
job at supervising youth. She reported she gets annoyed with staff
because they are constantly redirecting her for personal boundaries
and keeping space. Youth B reported she is on a safety plan on the unit
due to her sexualized behaviors and reported she has never touched
anyone inappropriately. She reported she once was dating Youth A but
that is not happening anymore. Youth B denied any sexualized
behaviors occurring between the two youth. She reported she has
never seen anyone get touched inappropriate at the facility.
4

Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
6, 2023. Supervisor reported there has been no concerns brought to
her attention about Youth B touching Youth A inappropriately or making
inappropriate comments. She reported Youth A and Youth B attempted
to be in a dating relationship at one point and because of this they were
moved to be sleeping in separate hallways. Supervisor reported there
was an incident on January 21, 2023, where Youth B had flashed her
breast in the milieu when her shirt slid up her when Youth B was sliding
her back down the couch. She reported staff handled that situation
appropriately. Supervisor reported Youth B has a safety plan in place
because of her sexualized behaviors from her trauma history. She
reported staff are aware of this safety plan and that Youth B should
never be alone with another peer, should be closely monitored and
should not be directly sitting next to another peer or staff . Supervisor
reported the safety plan is within Youth B’s binder in the staff office, the
team reviews the safety plan at every team meeting and updates are
sent out via email.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were separately interviewed face to face at the
facility on February 6, 2023. Both staff reported Youth A has never
brought concerns to them about Youth B being sexually inappropriate
towards them. They reported no other staff or youth have brought up
concerns to them of Youth B touching them and never have seen Youth
B touching any youth inappropriate. Each staff member explained
Youth B does have a sexualized safety plan where she should maintain
within arm’s length of staff when not in her bedroom or bathroom. Youth
B will sometimes need to be redirected for making sexualized
comments or jokes. They reported Youth B is to not to sit right next to
any staff or youth because she does not do well with personal space. It
was reported staff did have heighten supervision between the two youth
because there were concerns, they may be dating. It was made sure
that both Youth A and Youth B were not within the same bedroom
hallway and tried to be separated when doing smaller group activities.
They both reported they know about Youth B’s safety plan from talking
about it at the team meeting, it being within the safety office, and the
team being in constant communication about what is going on in the
unit. They both reported they each have no concerns with other staff’s
ability to supervise the youth or follow Youth B’s safety plan.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on February 6, 2023. Staff 3
reported she just recently started working at the facility and has been
completing shadow shift. She reported Youth A never reported any
concerns to her about Youth B being sexually inappropriate. She
reported Youth A was telling another peer to watch out for Youth B
because she dated her before, and she is not a good partner to be with.
There were no reports of any physical touching occurring. Staff 3
4

reported she is aware of Youth B’s safety plan and has been trained
that Youth B needs an extra level of supervision. She reported she has
no concerns with the other staff’s level of supervision with youth on the
unit.
Detective was interviewed via phone on February 10, 2023.
Detective was given an update about the interviews that occurred with
this consultant. Detective reported she will be looking into the concerns
of the sexual abuse that did not occur within the facility and does not
have concerns with the facilities level of supervision of the youth.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on February 6, 2023. The staff office
was viewed and Youth B’s Personal Safety plan was located to be in
her working file that staff has easy access to.
Documentation
- Email with Youth A’s Foster Care Worker dated February 3,
2023 - Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported she was informed
Youth A has the baseline of intermittent/fleeting homicidal
thoughts towards peers on their unit. She reported there was
some inappropriate note passing between Youth A and a peer
about six months ago but no other reports or concerns regarding
any physical or sexual misconduct between peers or adults at
the facility. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported she has no
concerns with the facility or their programing.
- Youth B’s Personal Safety Plan dated January 12, 2022-
Youth B has a personal safety plan due to Youth B’s previous
sexualized trauma with the goal of minimizing safety risk and
helping Youth B develop healthy habits regarding personal
boundaries. Youth B is to not sit directly next to peers when on
outings; Youth B is to not be unsupervised 1:1 with a peer at any
time and will be closely monitored in the hallways; Youth B will
maintain boundaries with peers and staff; Youth B will minimize
inappropriate sexualized comments around peers and be
promptly and privately redirected by staff.
- Facility’s Staff Ratio Procedure- This procedure notes staff are
required to maintain line-of-sight supervision of youths at all
times expect when youth are in their individual sleeping rooms or
bathrooms.
- Incident report dated January 21, 2023- Youth B was sitting in
the milieu with her arms in her shirt stating she was cold. Youth
B slid her back down the side of the couch which lead to her shirt
rising up and exposed the bottom of both her right and left
4

breast. Staff verbally redirected Youth B to sit properly in her
chair and put a sweatshirt on if she was cold. Youth A was in the
milieu when this occurred. After the incident occurred, Youth B
was provided some coaching about body exposure and Staff
processed with Youth A about the incident. No other concerns
noted at that time.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with the level of staff supervision.
Staff within the facility are knowledgeable to Youth B’s safety plan and
there were no reports of concerns of staff supervision.
Consultation: The chief administrator, supervisor, and licensing
consultant spoke about reviewing this concern with the team and
making sure the team is up to date on Youth B’s plan. It was also
recommended to have a female staff member to do check in’s with
Youth A, per her request, about how she is feeling and if there is any
concerns with Youth B making comments towards her that staff are not
aware of.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
February 13, 2023
